result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered restitution payable in the stipulated amounts as follows: $2,000.00 to Crime Victim Compensation Program and $205.00 to Michelle W.

Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments and costs within 35 years; any remaining balance to convert to a civil judgment. Court ordered that all financial obligations and restitution be paid through collections of sums by the DOC's from 25% of prison funds to be paid within 35 years. Any remaining balance to convert to a civil judgment.
CONSECUTIVE to any other time being served

superMiscConds.notes: - NO CONTACT with victim's immediate family members.

- Obtain Mental Health Assessment and complete any recommended counseling and/or follow-up care/treatment; take any medication prescribed.
- Participate in Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Therapy programming.

- Obtain AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms or body armor. Defendant also advised because he has been convicted of a violent felony under Section 941.29, if he possesses a firearm within 5 years of completing this felony sentence, he will be subject to a mandatory 3 year initial confinement sentence. Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovan T Mull

records.addlTxt: Motion for Extension of Time to File Response Brief, courtesy copy received and filed.

Per Order dated June 15, 2022  Appeal No 2020AP1362-CR
IT IS ORDERED that the motion is granted. Plaintiff-respondent-petitioner's initial brief shall be served and filed on or before July 18, 2022.

Per Order dated May 18, 2022, Appeal No 2020AP1362-CR, 
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is granted and that pursuant to Wis. Stat. Rule 809.62(6), the plaintiff-respondent-petitioner may not raise or argue issues not set forth in the petition for review unless otherwise ordered by the court; and
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that pursuant to Wis. Stat. Rules 809.62(6) and 809.63, within 30 days after the date of this order the plaintiff-respondent-petitioner must file a brief in this court; that within 20 days of filing the defendant-appellant, Jovan T. Mull, must file either a brief or a statement that no brief will be filed; and that if a brief is filed by the defendant-appellant, within 10 days of filing the plaintiff-respondent-petitioner must file either a reply brief or a statement that no reply brief will be filed; and 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that in any brief filed in this court the parties shall not incorporate by reference any portion of their court of appeals' brief or petition for review or response; instead, any material in these documents upon which there is reliance should be restated in the brief filed in this court; and
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the first brief filed in this court must contain, as part of the appendix, a copy of the decision of the court of appeals in this case; and
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, if a party has not previously filed an electronic copy of the briefs filed on behalf of that party in the court of appeals, the party, within 30 days after the date of this order, must provide the clerk of this court with 10 copies of the brief previously filed on behalf of that party in the court of appeals; but if the party has already filed an electronic copy of such briefs, then there is no obligation to provide additional copies of those briefs to the clerk of this court; and
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the allowance of costs, if any, in connection with the granting of the petition will abide the decision of this court on review.
Acknowledgment receipt of the Petition for Review has been filed with the Wisconsin Supreme Court - Appeal No. 2020AP001362-CR
Assigned per succession calendar.
File forwarded to Branch 40 per Court of Appeals Decision dated and filed February 1, 2022 - Judgment and order reversed and cause remanded for further proceedings consistent with this decision.

Per Decision dated and filed February 1, 2022, Appeal No 2020AP1362-CR, 
By the Court.-Judgment and order reversed and cause remanded for further proceedings consistent with this decision. 
This opinion will not be published. See WIS. STAT. RULE. 809.23(1)(b)5.

At the hour of 11:22 the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to Count 1, which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.

Defendant Jovan T Mull in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Jovan T Mull in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Jury trial continued.  Case called at 8:54 am.  Jury in the box at 8:54 am.  Jury retired at the hour of 8:55 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff Deputies Spottek and Vandertie who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury out of the box at 8:55 am.

Case recalled.  At the hour of 11:22 the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY as to Count 1, which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court ordered a PSI without a recommendation.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Jury in the box: 2:04 pm. Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:52 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy J. Cross who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Jury out of the box: 11:50 am. Trial recessed for lunch.
